title: 256D.45 PAYMENT PERIOD.
text:
The payment period and budgeting cycle for Minnesota supplemental aid are those of the Supplemental Security Income program.
The county agency shall apply a gross income test prospectively for each month of program eligibility. An assistance unit is ineligible when nonexcluded income, before applying any disregards or deductions, exceeds 300 percent of the Supplemental Security Income standard for an individual.
The amount of assistance is the difference between the recipient's net income and the applicable standards of assistance in section 256D.44, subdivisions 2 to 4, for persons living independently.
